p: It should be noted that ethanol was also able to interact with many active substances of other medicines that the child is taking [ 29] and, therefore, possible interactions must be studied prior to concomitant administration. Furthermore, new contributions in the scientific literature on excipients, including ethanol, is expected to help health professionals predict the risks of using a particular excipient, especially in the paediatric population. For example, the guideline excipients in the label and package leaflet of medicinal products for human use alerts on the risk of the use of ethanol and proposes changes on its use.
